bibl.title: List of the representatives paying tribute at the Camp Lazear dedication ceremony, December 3, 1952

div1.p: This list includes representatives from universities and institutions paying tribute at the Camp Lazear dedication ceremony. Also included are the names of the honorees.

div1.head: List of the representatives paying tribute at the Camp Lazear dedication ceremony, December 3, 1952

list.item:
1 - Representative of The American Medical Association
Dr. R. B. Chrisman (of Inport Bldg., Miami Agramonte
Lazear
or Hench
“The American Medical Association pays honor to Drs. Finlay and Delgado
and to Mayor Reed and his associates. Homage to the Conquerors of Yellow
Fever”.

2 - Major General Paul Streit -
Commanding General Walter Reed Hospital - Washington - Representing the
Surgeon General of the United States Army.....
Hommage to the Conquerors of yellow fever - Dr. Carlos Finlay, Major Walter
Reed and their associates - From the Surgeon general George Armstrong."

3 - Dr. Philip Hench
“The Mayo Foundation of the University of Minnesota presents this tribute
to the glorious memory of Drs. Finlay, Delgado, Reed and their Associates
The Conquerors of Yellow Fever”.

4 - Dr. Leandro Tocantins -
Professor of Clinical and Experimental Medicine, Jefferson Medical College,
Philadelphia.
"Jefferson Medical College proundly presents this tribute to honotr its dis-
tinguished graduate of 1855 Dr. Carlos Finlay.

5 - Mr. William Caswell
“Harvard University and its medical School considers it an honor to pay this
tribute to the Conquerors of yellow fever in memory of its distinguished graduate
of 1887 General Leonard Wood”.

6 - Dr. Emilio Jane, Alumnus of Bellvue Medical Center - (In Dr. Jane's
Absence Dr. Hench will present a wreath from the Bellvue Medical Center,
New York University in memory of its distinguished graduate, Walter Reed,
class of 1870".

7 - Dr. Jose Echeverria -
Alumnus of the University of Maryland -
“The University of Maryland and its School of Medicine places this wreath in
CARROLL
honor of Major James Carool graduate of the class of 1892”.

8 - Dr. Raimundo de Castro
President of the Columbia University Alumni Club of Cuba
“The College of Physicians and Surgeons of Columbia University places this
wreath in honor of Dr. Aristides Agramonte, eminent graduate of the class of
1892.”

9 - Dr. Raimundo de Castro
"In memory of Dr. Jesse W. Lazear who gave his life for mankind this wreath is
proudly placed by The college of Physicians and Surgeons of Columbia University.

10 - General Streit
“By order of the Surgeon General U. S. Army General Streit has the privilege
of placing this wreath in memory of the American Soldiers, who with their
Cuban and Spanish Comrades risked their lives for the Service of Mankind”.

11 -
Professor de Castro -

of the United States Army in 1900.- Graduate 1860 of the College of Physicians and
Surgeons of Columbia University”.

12 - General Streit
“To the memory of Major Walter Reed, this tribute from The Walter Reed Memorial
Association of Washington”.
